tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
"This is for the director of music to use in worship"
This may refer to a style of music. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:psa:006:001|6:1]].
Possible meanings are 1) David wrote the psalm or 2) the psalm is about David or 3) the psalm is in the style of David's psalms.
"Yahweh, come to my aid"
"faithful people have all vanished"
The two occurrences of "everyone" are exaggerations, used to emphasize that the problem is serious. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
"false praise"
"words that deceive"
"stop them from speaking false praise"
Here the "tongue" represents boastful speech. AT: "every person who is boasting" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: With our tongues will we prevail
tn.text: Here the words "our tongues" represent the many words that they speak. AT: "Speaking many words will make us victorious" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"we will succeed" or "we will win"

tn.ref: who can be master over us?
tn.text: This rhetorical question is asked to emphasize that they believed no one could rule over them. It can be translated as a statement. AT: "no one can rule over us!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
These are deep sounds that people make because of pain or some strong emotion.
This means Yahweh will do something to help the people.

tn.ref: like silver purified in a furnace on the earth, refined seven times
tn.text: Yahweh's words are compared to silver that has been purified. AT: "they are without any imperfection" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
"You keep the righteous people safe"
"surround us"

tn.ref: when evil is exalted among the children of mankind
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when people everywhere are praising evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"human beings" or "people"
